Cuerpo: Date: Thursday, 21-Nov-96 23:20:43 GMT Server: NCSA/1.3 MIME-version: 1.0 Content-type: text/html Last-modified: Wednesday, 16-Oct-96 18:02:43 GMT Content-length: 5025 Erich Nahum's Home Page (nahum@cs.umass.edu) Erich Nahum Research Assistant Department of Computer Science Lederle Graduate Research Center Box 34610 University of Massachusetts Amherst, MA 01003-4610, USA Phone: (413) 545-3179 Fax: (413) 545-1249 Email: nahum@cs.umass.edu I'm a Ph.D. candidate in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Massachusetts . My advisors are Jim Kurose and Don Towsley . I also work closely with David Yates . I received my B.A. in computer science from The University of Wisconsin in 1988 and my M.S. degree in computer science from UMass in 1991. When they let me, I try to collaborate with the Network Systems Research Group at the University of Arizona CS Department . I'm a member of the ACM, IEEE, and USENIX. Research Interests Network protocols, multiprocessors, operating systems, security. More detail about me or my research can be found in my Curriculum Vitae Recent Papers Networking Support for Large Scale Multiprocessor Servers , David J. Yates, Erich M. Nahum, James F. Kurose, and Don Towsley . Parallelized Network Security Protocols , Erich Nahum, David Yates, Sean O'Malley, Hilarie Orman and Rich Schroeppel . Slides from the talk are also available. Third IEEE Workshop on the Architecture and Implementation of High Performance Communications Subsystems (HPCS `95), Aug. 1995 (Mystic, Conn). Also available as Technical Report 95-04, Department of Computer Science, University of Arizona, March 1995. Networking Support for Large Scale Multiprocessor Servers (Extended Abstract) , David J. Yates, Erich M. Nahum, James F. Kurose, and Don Towsley . Third IEEE Workshop on the Architecture and Implementation of High Performance Communications Subsystems (HPCS `95), Aug. 1995 (Mystic, Conn).
